title: Final Fantasy
content:
Final Fantasy # Also known as # Final Fantasy I・II, Final Fantasy Origins, Final Fantasy I & II: Dawn of Souls, Final Fantasy I & II Advance
Platforms # Famicom, NES, MSX2, WonderSwan Color, PS, GBA, Mobile phone (J2ME), PSP, Wii Virtual Console, PSOne Classics, iOS, Windows Phone, Android, Nintendo 3DS Virtual Console, Wii U Virtual Console, 3DS (Nintendo eShop), Wii U Virtual Console, NES Classic Edition, Windows
Fullest version # PSP, iOS (2010), Windows Phone, 3DS (Nintendo eShop)
Comment # Higher-resolution 2D graphics, FMV sequences, remixed soundtrack, bonus dungeons, and script from Dawn of Souls. Note: almost every version has visual, audio- and balance changes, so technically there can’t be the fullest version
Most stable version # GBA, PSP, Windows (Steam), Android (2021), iOS (2021)
Comment # Almost every next version fixes some of the bugs of previous editions
Best look # PSP, Windows (Steam), Android (2021), iOS (2021)
Comment # PSP version has many nice visual effects that make the game looks more modern. 2D remaster version (Steam/2021) looks as polished classic 2D
Additional links # Wikipedia – Final Fantasy (video game) Which Version of Final Fantasy I Should You Play? - ALL Ports Reviewed + Compared

title: Final Fantasy II
content:
Final Fantasy II # Also known as # Final Fantasy I・II, Final Fantasy Origins, Final Fantasy I & II: Dawn of Souls, Final Fantasy I & II Advance
Platforms # Famicom, WonderSwan Color, PS, GBA, Mobile phone (J2ME), PSP, Wii Virtual Console, PSOne Classics, iOS, Windows Phone, Android, Nintendo 3DS Virtual Console, Wii U Virtual Console, 3DS Virtual Console, Wii U Virtual Console, NES Classic Edition, Windows
Fullest version # PSP, iOS (2010), Android (2012)
Comment # Higher-resolution 2D graphics, FMV sequences, remixed soundtrack, bonus dungeons, and script from Dawn of Souls. Note: almost every version has visual, audio- and balance changes, so technically there can’t be the fullest version
Most stable version # GBA, PSP, Windows (Steam), Android (all versions), iOS (all versions)
Comment # Almost every next version fixes some of the bugs of previous editions
Best look # PSP, Windows (Steam), Android (2021), iOS (2021)
Comment # PSP version has many nice visual effects that make the game looks more modern. 2D remaster version (Steam/2021) looks as polished classic 2D
Additional links # Wikipedia – Final Fantasy II Which Version of Final Fantasy II Should You Play? - ALL Ports Reviewed & Compared

title: Final Fantasy III
content:
Final Fantasy III # Platforms # Famicom, Nintendo DS, Wii Virtual Console, iOS, Android, PSP, Ouya, Windows Phone, Wii U Virtual Console, Nintendo 3DS Virtual Console, Windows, NES Classic Edition, Android, IOS
Fullest version # none or any
Comment # There are 3 various versions of the game: Original (Famicom, all Virtual Consoles, NES Classic Edition), 3D Remake (Nintendo DS, iOS (2011), Android (2012), PSP, Ouya, Windows Phone, Windows (2014)) and 2D (pixel) Remastered (iOS (2021), Android (2021), Windows (2021)). All of them have various gameplay features, graphic style, etc.
Most stable version # Nintendo DS, iOS, Android, PSP, Ouya, Windows Phone, Windows, NES Classic Edition, Android, IOS
Best look # 3D Remake: iOS (2011), Android (2012), Ouya, Windows Phone, Windows (2014). 2D Remaster: iOS (2021), Android (2021), Windows (2021)
Comment # 3D Remake version – full 3D remake. 2D remaster version looks as polished classic 2D
Additional links # Wikipedia – Final Fantasy III Which Version of Final Fantasy III Should You Play? - ALL Ports Reviewed & Compared

title: Final Fantasy IV
content:
Final Fantasy IV # Also known as # Final Fantasy IV Easy Type, Final Fantasy Collection, Final Fantasy IV Advance, Final Fantasy IV: The Complete Collection, Final Fantasy 25th Anniversary Ultimate Box, “This is not a Final Fantasy II?”
Platforms # SNES, Super Famicom, PS, WonderSwan Color, GBA, Nintendo DS, Wii Virtual Console, PSP, iOS, Android, Windows, PSOne Classic, PS3, PS Vita, Wii U Virtual Console
Fullest version # None. Closest to the most complete version: PSP (The Complete Collection), iOS (3D), Android (3D), Windows (3D)
Comment # There are 3 groups of versions: original (SNES, Super Famicom, PS, WonderSwan Color, GBA, Wii, PSP (The Complete Collection), PSOne Classic, PS3, PS Vita, PSP, Wii U), 3D-Remake (Nintendo DS, iOS, Android, Windows) and 2D-Remaster (iOS, Android, Windows). Only PSP version has prequel “Interlude”. Only iOS/Android/Windows 3D-versions have “The After Years”
Most stable version # PS, PS3, PS Vita, PSP, Nintendo DS, iOS, Android, Windows
Comment # SNES, Super Famicom, GBA (GBA only JP v1.0 and NA) versions have many bugs and translation problems
Best look # PSP (Final Fantasy IV: The Complete Collection), iOS, Android, Windows (both 3D and 2D-Remaster)
Comment # 3D Remake version – full 3D remake. 2D remaster version looks as polished classic 2D
Additional links # Wikipedia –Final Fantasy IV Which Version of Final Fantasy IV Should You Play? - ALL Ports Reviewed & Compared

Comment # PS4, Xbox One, Switch versions have problems with blinking faces
Additional links # Which Version of Final Fantasy 7 Should You Play? - All FF7 Ports Reviewed & Compared

title: Flashback (1992)
content:
Flashback (1992) # Also known as # Flashback: Remastered Edition
Platforms # Amiga, Acorn Archimedes, Mega Drive/Genesis, MS-DOS, Windows, NEC PC-9801, Super NES, Sega CD, FM Towns, 3DO, CD-i, Atari Jaguar, Mac OS, iOS, Symbian, Maemo, Dreamcast, Switch, PS4, Xbox One
Fullest version # None
Comment # None additional content exists,the difference lies in two types of cutscenes. In older, slowest platforms cutscenes are 2D, on Sega CD, MS-DOS and some other cutscenes made in pseudo-3D. In Remastered edition is used 2D cutscenes. In Remastered Edition added playback mechanic (as in racing games from Codemasters).
Most stable version # ???
Comment # There is monstrous input lag in Windows (GOG) Remastered edition. Need to check other versions
Best look # PS4, Xbox One, Windows (GOG)

title: Metal Gear Solid
content:
Metal Gear Solid # Also known as # Metal Gear Solid: Integral, Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes (Remake)
Platforms # PS, PSP, PS3, PS Classic, Windows, GameCube
Fullest version # PS (Integral [J] / VR Missions Addon [U] / Special Missions Addon [E])

Most stable version # PS, PSP, PS3, PS Classic, Windows, GameCube
Best look # PS-emulator (MGS:Integral) with enhancements, Windows (MGS) + resolution mods, GameCube-emulator (Twin Snakes)
Comment # PS-emulator is more preferable than windows from gameplay point.
